website_summaries.verdict: This spacious cable management box is perfect for the entertainment system, gaming room, or anywhere you have a surplus of wires.
pros: Made from durable plastic with a deep, spacious interior
The simple matte black design is stylish and easily blends into your decor
The lid seals tightly and securely, keeping wires safe from dust build-up and accidental spills
Included twist ties make organization even simpler inside of the box
There are small rubber feet on the bottom to prevent slipping and sliding
cons: Sit's at a higher price point than most

customer_reviews.title: makes a BIG difference
customer_reviews.text: Would get 5 stars if it was a bit less expensive, but still worth it. I had earlier purchased the smaller one, and have been very happy with it. This bigger one cleaned up a big mess of cords on my living room entertainment center. For before and after pictures,see pic I uploaded to this page.
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: It's like magic!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the business! It's done wonders for the aesthetic by my computer! Check out the pics. My Belkin surge protector is pretty large and it fits inside with room for excess cables! Paired with some Velcro straps and/or cable tubing you'll be in good shape! Love this thing although I do agree that it is a tad expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Box is smaller than stated on website
customer_reviews.text: Big disappointment. The dimensions given on the website aren't correct. The external height of the box I received is 5.25", not 5.5" and the internal height is only 5". The width is 6", not 6.5". The box isn't tall enough to accommodate my power strip and Mac Powerbook block plug. It's also just a cheaply made plastic box. Doesn't begin to be worth it's price.
customer_reviews.author: Kaly

customer_reviews.title: Safety first, kids
customer_reviews.text: Upon looking at it I thought to myself, wtf?! Why did I buy this box?? Then I actually put it on the ground and set it up. I stepped back and looked at it again and changed my mind immediately. I can’t believe I’m saying this.. But I enjoy this plastic wire box. It’s pretty cool and keeps my cords from getting wet in the kitchen. Do I wish it was cheaper? Yeah. But at least I won’t start a fire.
customer_reviews.author: pearl

customer_reviews.title: Cleared the cord clutter
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the large size to clean up the nest of cords under my TV. It holds a surprising amount, and it's wide enough for a two-plug-wide power strip to sit flat on the bottom, which I wasn't sure it would. The black color is fairly subtle and just looks like a small, neat electronics item, instead of a mass of coiled cords, power supplies, etc.
customer_reviews.author: EG

customer_reviews.title: Unnecessary adhesive, glued note at the bottom of the box
customer_reviews.text: What's the deal with the adhesive placed on the note at the bottom of the box telling people to upload a photo of their hidden cables? Why does a note need to be glued to the bottom of the box, forcing customers to pull it off and leaving residue on the box. Include a loose note card with the product vs gluing it to the bottom of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Pete

customer_reviews.title: Totally Overpriced but Looks Beautiful and Works
customer_reviews.text: I don't think anyone can feel good about spending $30 on what is for all intents and purposes a plastic box. That said, it does look beautiful in person. It fits my big 12-outlet power strip and the lid has a satisfying feel when locked in. A bundle of huge cables vs one sleek looking box is a night-and-day difference, so I'm very happy with the purchase. I just can't get over the fact that a plastic box costs $30.
customer_reviews.author: Where Are My Droids?

customer_reviews.title: Its a box
customer_reviews.text: Its a plastic box. Plain and simple. Its pretty hard to mess this up. It fits two power strips well enough. It looks sleek. Its sturdy. Its a little bigger than I wanted it to be. It wasn't worth $30 for a simple box, though. I wouldn't return it, but I definitely could have bought something a lot cheaper that did the same exact thing. If you don't mind spending $30 on a box, I'd go for this one. But you can definitely spend less money and get essentially the same product.
customer_reviews.author: Elian

customer_reviews.title: It's a box.  A good looking box.
customer_reviews.text: Never even knew these were things. I bought two though and it's great. They fit rather large power strips and allow you to dump all your excess cabling in with only the needed bits coming out the sides. Makes things look far better. It does come with some cable ties, but they're those annoying plastic twist ones that are annoying to use. I used my own and threw those away. It's pretty much a box with holes on the side to allow cables to escape. For those that truly love proper cable management.
customer_reviews.author: Acquire

customer_reviews.title: Simple, sturdy, clean
customer_reviews.text: These simple little boxes are great for what I needed, getting a clean look. The plastic is thicker than what I expected, it's plenty sturdy enough. The lids fit tight with no issue either. My only complaint is all in all these are a little pricy for simple plastic boxes. But they get the job done. As other reviews said they do still have the adhesive paper in the bottom that you almost cant get up, but it's inside the box so it won't ever really be seen, so not as huge of a deal to me as other people seem to have with it. Overall great and simple!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solved my problem
customer_reviews.text: As evidenced by before photo I had a tangled mess of cords. The cable box management system totally solved it . It was easy to set up. The photo also includes Bestfy cord organizer system that is a sleeve which covers the cables. Between the two products I had a perfect result. The bestfy product covered the dangling cables, and the box contains the power strip. I thought the box was a bit pricey for just a plastic box, but it totally fixed the mess
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great box to hide/stash your power strip and cables
customer_reviews.text: This little (actually very big) plastic box really works. Loved it to mange/hide power blocks and cords and the power strip. My cats were playing with the cords at the power strip and these keeps them away. Price is a bit high, but it really works! Love it. I'm probably going to buy 2 more to use at the computer desk. Today's project just dealt with the TV mess of wires. Highly recommended! Used this with a captive cable sleeve (also sold on amazon). Perfect combo. If you want to clear up a cable mess, this box will help a lot. See before and after pictures to see how great they work.
customer_reviews.author: T. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Large enough to fit a wide power strip like the, and with enough hight for a Macbook ...
customer_reviews.text: I swear by these boxes. Large enough to fit a wide power strip like the, and with enough hight for a Macbook Pro power adaptor, these boxes take a rats nest and make it look like an unremarkable box. Solid construction, comes with twist ties.
customer_reviews.author: T. G. Cline

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Solution
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure this would be helpful for ALL the cords and wires I needed to organize, but it worked out great! I had computer, scanner, phone, printer, wireless router, internet modem power cords and wires to organize. I'm sad that I didn't take a picture of the mess before. It did take me a while to organize and untangle all the cords, but once done, I was very happy with the result. I used the Velcro One Wrap ties for this project too. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: walkey.talkie

customer_reviews.title: Great box for cables.
customer_reviews.text: This box is slightly larger than I imagined, but that's good because I ended up really laying down the cable. It's look is very understated, which is exactly what you'd want if hiding things was the point. I use this for my desk at home and my cable game is now on point! I can see why this thing is ~$25. It's well built, probably way more than it would ever really need to be, and the lid fits snugly. I've placed mine intentionally out of view but even if it weren't it wouldn't be an eyesore. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended but arrived damaged.
customer_reviews.text: The size is great and has plenty of space for excess cables. Unfortunately mine came cracked at the bottom, but the rubber feet are preventing it from splitting more so I decided to keep it. Because of the crack the top cover is lose and cables that I did not zip tie together kept pushing the lid up, but after some cable managing the cover stays on and the box is hidden behind the TV where no sees it. Overall the product works as intended but am disappointed that there was some damage to mine.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo M.

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced plastic box
customer_reviews.text: These plastic boxes are bigger markups than cables sold at big box stores. Way overpriced for what they are. I guess since they're electronics-related people will pay it. There are some pros to this specific one with the sticky rubber pads on the bottom and a secure albeit flimsy top lid. Overall, not worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Matt B

customer_reviews.title: A Bit Pricey, But The Right Size
customer_reviews.text: This has done a fantastic job of reducing cord clutter in my living room to hide the cables for my power-reclining sofa. There are cheaper ones out there, but at the time this one was the only one that would fit my surge protector inside it with enough room to spare so that the wall warts would fit as well. Build quality is pretty solid all things considered, and I really have no complaints about the product itself. Pricing is the only thing keeping me from having 10+ of these in my house, hiding every exposed cord I could get my hands on. In the mean time I'm happy with the one I have.
customer_reviews.author: Incoherent Drivel

customer_reviews.title: Useful for,keeping things tidy
customer_reviews.text: I've used this box in my office to hide the various power cords from monitors, laptops, speakers, etc. Got a couple more to do the same behind our A/V system. The box does a good job of hiding the many cables that run to and fro behind the equipment. Be careful to find the right size surge protector. The only challenge has been the various items that use power bricks. I've had mixed success fitting these in the box, so sometimes it's a organizational game of running from the equipment to the brick to the power strip in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Jason S.

customer_reviews.title: Too Narrow in some instances
customer_reviews.text: The box is helpful in tidying up the area under my desk. There is one problem. Four of my plugs are the transformer block type. My power strip fits comfortably inside the box, but the transformer blocks require more space than the box allows. Consequently I still must use another power strip outside of the box to accommodate these larger plugs.
customer_reviews.author: Bill O

customer_reviews.title: Simple yet “elegant” solution
customer_reviews.text: For years the area behind the “entertainment center” looked as if Medusa’s disembodied head had been thrown back there. This unsightly mess became a problem with the arrival of a new kitten. It took 45 minutes but the power strip and assorted cables all fit inside rather nicely. I was even able to put the Boost mini-router (for the Sonos system) in the box as well. No more entanglements!!!!
customer_reviews.author: BklynMac

customer_reviews.title: Nice countermeasure to growing disorder
customer_reviews.text: My den was in need of some cable management (multiple lights, multiple monitors, computer, surge protector). This cable box made the unsightly array of power cables disappear. I was worried that the brand label would be a little too much, but it was not. One side bar: I added a black, zippered cable-managing element to improve the look even more.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: My plugs don't fit perfectly with the lid on. ...
customer_reviews.text: My plugs don't fit perfectly with the lid on. The surge protector is too wide with all the extra large plugs (which are on the side not taking up space in the center). Other than that, definitely worth the purchase. I still needed some cord wraps in order to hide what was between the box and the TV, but this does a decent job.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Cunnington

customer_reviews.title: [Decent Sized]  It can cram wires in and stay closed
customer_reviews.text: It's a box... that you can put cables in. Great for organizing, I just wish it was cheaper and bigger. If you are worried about the cost, try to make your own. If the cost means nothing, go ahead and get it. I use to stuff long cables inside. It's durable, I have kneed it on it more than once. Fits all the power surge outlets I own. As a gamer and wires-everywhere-kind-of-guy, I have a few of these. It can cram wires in and stay closed. If you mix this with a wire feeder, it's a well organized set up. I bought this with the "Cable Management Sleeve, JOTO Cord Management...". Really cleans up the place.
customer_reviews.author: Redtail Animations

customer_reviews.title: Why did i pay this much again?
customer_reviews.text: This product is way over priced. It does do a nice job of cable management, but its basically like a glorified shoe box that you are paying top dollar for. I would recommend shopping for inexpensive cord box management. This box is not special.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Leventhal

customer_reviews.title: Hides the mess well
customer_reviews.text: Got this to see if I could tidy up how the workspace looked and it helps keep everything inside. Looks way better than being able to see the power strip. This is definitely an aesthetic peripheral but if you're looking to make your work area look tidier this works great.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Solid, Sturdy, Staticy
customer_reviews.text: A rather big box for desk cables but it does the job very well. Sturdy and easy to put together. The biggest problem -- holy COW is it staticy. Cat hair and dust flies right to it and there are crackles when I wipe it off!
customer_reviews.author: ElectronicFerret

customer_reviews.title: Keeps wires neat and organized how I like it
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing ! It keeps the behind of my entertainment center from not looking like a disaster! I kind of a neat freak so I wish I would have gotten this sooner ! Great build quality.
customer_reviews.author: JOSE

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive, but worth it
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea why this needs to cost $30. However, it's awesome. Thick, wide, soft rubber feet on the bottom help prevent it from rattling and moving across the floor and from scratching furniture. The slots on either side make it easy to load and service whatever is inside without snaking through holes. There is plenty of space inside for two 6-outlet power strips side-by-side. The lid fits tightly and securely. It is definitely not just a cheap plastic box. Still, if it cost $15 I'd have ten of these in the house. Combined with black ethernet and HDMI cables, this helped me significantly improve the clutter behind my living room TV stand.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great organizational tool!  Safe and good quality.
customer_reviews.text: This cable box is great, and is exactly what I was looking for to organize all of the cables under our desk. It is good quality and large enough to fit a normal size power strip, perhaps even a double wide power strip. It is also safe. It has air holes on the sides to allow air to flow through, so it does not become too hot. It is also tall enough so that when you plug something in, the cord has room and does not become bent.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Kanick

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Innovation!  I bought Three!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these boxes for around my house- Read reviews of this and other products - the bluelounge is more expensive, but reviews said this was very sturdy (competitors have cheaper flimsy plastic). They were correct, this is very, very sturdy. In one of my photos you can see I have my desktop computer speaker subwoofer box on top of the bluelounge unit. Whoever invented this, have a drink on me!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stogsdillalover

customer_reviews.title: Simple and works perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to clean up the clutter of wires behind the TV. Couldn't stand the sight of all those wires hanging behind the TV stand, not to mention, they posed a risk whenever my 3 year old was back there attempting to play with all of them. Found the Bluelounge CableBox and decided to give it a try based on all the good reviews. It worked perfectly. I even managed to get the surge protector to fit inside with all the excess wires. Would definitely recommend it to anybody who wants to tidy up the wires either next to a TV, computer desk, or anywhere else where there's a "wired mess."
customer_reviews.author: Vinny and Jacob

customer_reviews.title: I should have got them two years ago.
customer_reviews.text: Why did I live with the mess for so long? Sturdy enough that I have my monitors standing on them. I have two lap-tops, two monitors, a powered port replicator, a lamp, and a couple of chargers on my desk. It was a real mess with cables running down the back of the desk and across it ....so ugly! Now I have all the cables and the port replicator stuffed in two of these boxes, and only a few short lengths of cable showing ...it looks so much better. Great idea, even if the price is a little steep when buying two.
customer_reviews.author: Grayboots

customer_reviews.title: It is just a plastic box and hard to fit in adapters.
customer_reviews.text: The item itself seems good quality. It is made of plastic, but not too flimsy. It is a neat idea and does help organize all the unruly wires. I was expecting some organizing compartment inside so I can organize my extra wires inside, but no...it is just a box with several ties (the kind of ties you can find in grocery store bag area.) So this item is way overpriced for what it is. The other down side is that if you have a 12-outlet surge protector and have standard-size adapters, then forget about it. It just will not fit in unless you want to stretch the box. FYI. I have a Belkin 12-outlet surge protector.
customer_reviews.author: An

customer_reviews.title: No longer a tangle of cables
customer_reviews.text: This box was excellent to organize a bunch of messy power cables that resided under a chair in our living room. That area is neat now ; >.
customer_reviews.author: JoyD

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose and looks nice, keeps the dust off the cables
customer_reviews.text: My surge protector and all the associated cables go in the box neatly for a nice clean appearance tucked behind my bedroom TV set. The size is perfect for one average-sized surge protector and the cables. Now I don't have to clean all the cables individually when I dust, which saves me SO much time (and sneezing!). I love it! I'd get another one for my living room TV but I have a lot more equipment there and it wouldn't all fit in one. I'd get two but can't bring myself to spend that much as they're pretty expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Marti R

customer_reviews.title: What a smart idea - no more rat's nests of cables
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these, one for the entertainment center and one for the office / computer area. The cable nest has never looked so good. UPDATE, TWO YEARS LATER: It's still one of the smartest things anybody ever invented, and one of the smartest purchases I've ever made. I'm still VERY satisfied with it. UPDATE, FOUR YEARS LATER: I'm still happy with this purchase. I would recommend this to ANYBODY trying to deal with a tangle of cables and power cords. It's sturdy and it handles abuse really well. It comes in several different colors, if black's not your thing.
customer_reviews.author: Robert R. Depew

customer_reviews.title: Great size.  Works well
customer_reviews.text: Great size. Securely seals. My only grip is that it is extremely difficult to get back open. I have bought a total of 6 of these to baby proof and organize all of our visible surge protectors.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: cleans up clutter of the end of my wires
customer_reviews.text: I use it for multiple items I use it to collect excess of power cord wire Inside.. and I have my computer tower on top off it to keep my tower off the floor
customer_reviews.author: Dean Smith Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy Anything Chinese
customer_reviews.text: This product is made in China. Deceptive advertising attempts to hide that info. The product is cheaply made, very little value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: D Dillard

customer_reviews.title: If you hate cords, buy this
customer_reviews.text: I thought long and hard about paying this much money for a plastic box, but I am glad I did. This box holds theand a mess of extra cord length with no problem. The lid fits securely even though we have quite a bit of extra cord tucked inside.
customer_reviews.author: Jules P

customer_reviews.title: A big improvement
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these to try and organize a home office. We have more than a dozen devices to plug in and I have tried multiple times to zip-tie things to make things neat. What I found is that I was adding or changing things so often that I was constantly cutting zip-ties and rearranging plugs and power strips. The two cableboxes look like they solve the problem. Excess wires are easily stuffed into the box, it will be easy to add or delete devices. Despite the size, they don't stand out under the desk. For me the biggest advantage is the ability to quickly add or delete things without hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Tom 5778

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit new MacBook Pro charging brick.
customer_reviews.text: I like box however the lid doesn't close with the new MacBook Pro power bricks. The wrapping the box comes in shows two different pictures of the box housing MacBook chargers. Considering most people will be using this for items with more chunky power bricks, the item should have increased dimensions for the length, width, and height.
customer_reviews.author: kris

customer_reviews.title: Must buy for cable management!
customer_reviews.text: This box is genius!! Used it to hide away all my cables. It was exactly what I was looking for. If you want a clean under desk buy this now!
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Quach

customer_reviews.title: aesthetically appealing
customer_reviews.text: hey, it's a plastic box! ;) it's a decent size to fit standard power strips, and it looks nice from a distance. Plastic finish was a bit lower quality than I expected at this price. Okay design, maybe some how implementing vents on the sides to allow for more airflow since depending on what you're using inside can get very hot. i.e. Apple power adapters. Although I haven't necessarily had any serious issues with heat after several months of use, I'd still much prefer a metal box/case with side venting, but this is the best option I've found.
customer_reviews.author: o m r

customer_reviews.title: It does what it says but it cracked
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says but beware that the plastic walls of the box are thin and it could crack. Mine cracked after I got it. The crack is toward the bottom after I put in my surge protector. I have some large power adapters that stick out of the sides of the surge protector a bit and I guess that the box was not wide enough to accommodate them. When I attempted to put the lid on, it cracked.
customer_reviews.author: Laura L Valdes

customer_reviews.title: Subtle and easy cord management
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I needed to contain cords and a surge protector attractively in my desk area. It's just a box with holes on either side and a top, so I guess if you were a DIYer you could make this out of wood or something else. However, I like that it was an easy solution and very subtle. I have a calendar and a candle on top of it and a frame in front of it. You can't even see it on my black desk. It's perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: T Pitts

customer_reviews.title: Not cheap but solves a real problem.
customer_reviews.text: Like many others have said, these boxes aren't exactly cheap. That said, they do solve the problem of wire messes quite nicely. The first BL CableBox I purchased went behind my LCD TV. It hides the power strip and mess of cabling nicely. I purchased three more for my retail restaurant. They are used to hide the router, power strips and cabling for my counter top mounted POS cash register systems. After speaking to a rep at Blue Lounge, I was told they will be offering a CableBox mini with included power strip in the US. The mini is currently available over-seas. I am looking forward to the mini. I would defiantly buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: DigitalGuy

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.text: My surge protector is behind my monitor, on top of my computer desk. After far too many instances of my cats sleeping on my desk and inadvertently turning off the surge protector, I decided to look for a protective case. This one arrived today, and I couldn't be happier with it. It's very sturdy, and it's the right size to cover everything. Naturally, when I was maneuvering the surge protector, computer cables, etc into the box, I ended up turning off the surge protector myself. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Nightshade1972

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!
customer_reviews.text: What a lifesaver! Behind our tv and DVD player cords were EVERYWHERE!! I could not imagine a solution to this dilemma! Then came the Bluelounge Cablebox! Wow! In no time, my son had ALL the cords AND the power strip IN the box, out of sight, behind the TV! I was simply amazed at the difference!! This little box really holds a lot! And it is safe.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa J. Rief

customer_reviews.title: Cords be gone!
customer_reviews.text: I HATE cords and this is perfect!! Solid and does the trick hiding all unwanted cords... especially the power strip!
customer_reviews.author: MJKing

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: Great for sorting that mess of cables under your desk. I put my entire power strip and surfboard modem inside with ease. Still has plenty of air space and airflow.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Trashy to Classy
customer_reviews.text: What a difference a box makes. Before & After. Took some arrangement but finally got it looking presentable.
customer_reviews.author: Deon

customer_reviews.title: Does the job ... but still too pricey!
customer_reviews.text: If you have a ikea near your house ... I recommend going their first to check this management cable box. It is a lot cheaper and does the job just as good. This looks good, but it is made of cheap plastic bins. I bought one from ikea and it is made of metal and wood and was like 20$ cheaper. I use this box for my computer cables and it hides them very well, its bigger than it looks in the picture but I like the size of it. just wished it was made of some better materials. Is not worth the money that I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Elvis

customer_reviews.title: Great idea!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these and they worked out wonderful. The box fits my 6 prong surge protectors just fine. I have 2 of them next to each other and the cords that come out of the box I placed those zip up cable sleeves around them. It made a big difference by not seeing all of those cords hanging everywhere. Talk about a neat tidy looking area! In regards to the construction of the box, well it's just thin plastic but sturdy and strong enough to hold the the thick cord of the surge protector inside it without any bulges on the box. I am completely satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Flowerchild

customer_reviews.title: price sucks
customer_reviews.text: I wish it were a thicker plastic for this price the edges bow out with all the cables from my home theater system smooshed in. (I have an open TV stand with little room for wire maintenance) If the plastic were a little more durable i think it would bow out like that. Other than that it's a pretty simple box with two exits for wires to hide in. It also fit my monster surge protector that has two rows of outlets just fine so for its functionality it would be a 5/5 for its value i'd say a 3/5 I wouldnt buy it again at this price. (around $26.50 when i bought it)
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Very GOOD
customer_reviews.text: I just set this up today , using it for my computer, speakers and printer, wow it was so easy and looks so much better. I hope it will be quick and easy if I have to open to reboot my router ect but I'm thinking it will be. So far nothing negative to say, was worth the money because it makes such a big difference in how my office area now looks, so clean and neat. I recommend this product, should of gotten it a long time ago!!
customer_reviews.author: Lulu

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! It got a little crowded with all the ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! It got a little crowded with all the cords behind my TV but is still extremely helpful and a good size so it doesn't draw too much attention to the black box.
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: I am really satisfied with this purchase, It is a bit pricey but for me it was worth it, The plastic is fairly thick and durable with a black matte finish on it. The box itself is actually pretty big, I have a Trip Lite 10 inside with about 10 outlets in use and 2 monitor power bricks and there is still room to spare.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Good cable management - sorts out the rat's nest of cables behind the TV!
customer_reviews.text: Very good product, good size for the job. Mine contains 2 six outlet power strips. My only complaint is it is very flexible and the lid pops off with cables pushing up on it. Sellotape on each end solved it though. I shall be experimenting fixing the power strips down to the bottom with double sided tape. I think it will help the overall cable stability.
customer_reviews.author: MrB

customer_reviews.title: Just great
customer_reviews.text: Wires are gone and just a black box you just don't see, unless you are looking for it....
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Love everything but the price
customer_reviews.text: Let's face it, this is a $30 plastic box with slits in the side and a lid. I almost hate myself for spending the money on this. With that said, I've looked and looked for something comparable, but nothing seems to exist with this level of build quality, or that can accommodate larger surge strips. After spending about an hour routing cables and putting things in Velcro ties though, I'm glad I bought it. I didn't exactly have a rat's nest, but it looks so much better than before.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great cable box!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these boxes as I bought two!! They cleaned up multiple cords and the area looks so much nicer. Don’t ask me why, but my kitty likes to lay on top of them! Sweeping around and under that area is so much easier!! Would buy over and over!!
customer_reviews.author: AuntB

customer_reviews.title: Useful & Genius Contraption
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's just a box. I never knew magical tools like this existed until my boyfriend showed me his. I ordered one for work and voila! No more getting my foot tangled in the jungles of unnecessary cables under my desk at work. When I switched jobs, I just dumped all the cords out and took it with me. This is a pretty nifty device and sometimes a lifesaver when unexpected spills occur near your electrical extension hubs and power strips.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Tidying Up
customer_reviews.text: Great for tidying up an area covered with cords. Work space looks much cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca M

customer_reviews.title: Too Small and Too Expensive
customer_reviews.text: This product is too expensive for what it is, and it's much too small to be effective. I had several cables to conceal, so I bought the large size box. Turns out the large size is still SMALL. I went out and bought a plastic tub at Walmart, cut the sides to fit the cables, and it worked like a charm. Cost a lot less, too!!
customer_reviews.author: Dr Sharon Bucholz

customer_reviews.title: Messy cables be gone.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is perfect. I've recently began micro organizing everything in the house and the one thing I'm not good at is cable management. I came across this on Amazon and thought... .why not. Pros: - Built very well. Seams match up well and you get a good feel for durability. - Exactly the size it should be to hold standard surge protectors. - Resembles a speaker or other electronic device so it blends well. Cons: - $30 for a tissue box ?! - I wonder about heat issues, but have experienced none.
customer_reviews.author: J Hiner

customer_reviews.title: Functional and Handsome Cable Management
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the more handsome cable management systems I have seen. It works well, looks good, and has sufficient capacity for the cables from a full gaming computer set up or medium sized entertainment system. I use it to manage the cables from a robust desktop gaming system as well as a laptop port replicator set up for my work laptop and all my cables fit nicely and neatly. Pros: - Good looking - Functional Cons: - Not large enough for all set-ups
customer_reviews.author: Zackariah

customer_reviews.title: It does what it says but could be half the price
customer_reviews.text: It is plenty big enough to hold the power strip with all plugs filled and with space to also hold the extra cords and cables. It has grippy rubber feet to keep it from slipping around and the lid has small tabs to keep it in place. The only downside is the price. Although it is plastic, it is not thin and cheap but it is still just a plastic box. If you have $30, it will make the pile of cords and plugs behind the big TV or under the desk tidy enough to please the wife.
customer_reviews.author: Tim R

customer_reviews.title: Works nicely. I have the power strip and all power cables from a TV, PS3, Apple TV and DirecTV box hidden inside it.
customer_reviews.text: Works nicely. I have the power strip and all power cables from a TV, PS3, Apple TV and DirecTV box hidden inside it. I've checked it several times and heat doesn't seem to be an issue. I used to have a small 4 port switch inside it too, and that had some heat to it but nothing ever was hot. If you find your box gets to warm for your liking you could always drill a few holes in the back of the box (the back wouldn't face you) to allow a bit of warm arm to escape.
customer_reviews.author: David S. Dickinson

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: wish it was a bit bigger so my Cyber Power can fit in, but it's alright.
customer_reviews.author: Noel Lincoln

customer_reviews.title: works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I love this box and it hides all those plugs and cables perfectly. everything described by the sell is accurate.
customer_reviews.author: BrianM_NJ

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but plastic
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t expect a cheap plastic box but rather something of more substance for this price. It looks nice but so would anything for this cost.
customer_reviews.author: dbpinochle

customer_reviews.title: Great way to hide your cables
customer_reviews.text: These boxes are great for bundling up and concealing your powerstrips and groups of cables and chords. I would buy a number of them if I could. They are a bit expensive for what they are though, just a plastic box really, with a nice design.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie S.

customer_reviews.title: Neat and simple Idea
customer_reviews.text: This tucks away my powerstrip, network switch, power wall warts and excess cables. It disappears from sight in my black tv stand.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Keeps everything tidy
customer_reviews.text: Simple design, spacious inside, and matches our TV/shelving colors. The cords are neatly bundled and keep our little one from being tempted to play with the outlets inside. My only improvement would be to put a means of locking it or securing it to make it more childproof. The lid form fits into place well enough, but it isn't difficult to open and get to the contents inside.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Donovan

customer_reviews.title: Cleaned up desk wonderfully!
customer_reviews.text: This cleaned up my craft desk! All those machines need power and cords are everywhere. This was the perfect solution and I can rest stuff on top of it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described, but way too much $ for what it is.
customer_reviews.text: It's a plastic box. I understand someone designed it, set up the manufacturing in China, etc. But still - it's a plastic shoe box with a hole on each end. I'd be wanting to give it 10 stars if I hadn't spent $30 on a plastic shoe box with holes in each end. That said, it works. As well as a plastic shoe box with holes on each end has to work.
customer_reviews.author: Babbo

customer_reviews.title: Simple, yet effective.
customer_reviews.text: Box did not include a surge protector, as some had suggested. Did not get the cable cords that should have been enclosed. No big deal. A very simple, well thought out, cable clutter management box that really hides most of the cable clutter. My surge protector fit in it easily, as well as its thick cord. Also my TIVO cord, TIVO wi fi cords w thick adapter, Roku cords, and everything else except the cable itself. Room finally looks free of cable clutter after years of disarray.
customer_reviews.author: P. Stein

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical that this box could actually hold my surge protector and all the related cords for my tv, DVR, DVD player and speaker system. It did! Within minutes of cleaning accumulated dust and dog hair from all the cords behind the tv system all the cords were safely stashed. Love this so much I'm ordering another for another room!
customer_reviews.author: TouchingPaws

customer_reviews.title: I bought a bunch in the past - perfect. Now
customer_reviews.text: I bought a bunch in the past - perfect. Now, I bought two more -- and they were fake chinese imitations. Doesn't have the logo; in generic cardboard boxes; a huge "Made in China" on the bottom. I'm not returning it because, well, it's just a plastic box so it will probably be fine, good enough. But disappointing that Amazon keeps on mixing up fake supplies and the real ones.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: CableBox - Black - Cable Management 15.6 X 5.7 inches
customer_reviews.text: What can I say It's a box, It has holes, cables run trough them. It hid the cable clutter perfectly. The only downside, is that it needed to be a little bit bigger to be able to fully use my (Belkin 12 Outlet Pivot Plug Surge Protector with 8 Foot Cord). But if you have anything else , you should be golden. For a plastic box, this is a little pricey but if you are OCD about your cables you will certainly wont regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Stylish way to hide ugly power strips
customer_reviews.text: Wow, now it doesn't look like a rat's nest of cables right next to my entertainment center. I love it! I didn't know if everything would fit, but it did, I was able to stuff 2 power strips in there
customer_reviews.author: Josh Barott

customer_reviews.title: My home AV system looks so clean and simple now!
customer_reviews.text: NICE! Not much to say here other than it does what you want, and does so VERY well. Even my rather large power strip, which even has in/out for my TV signal and telephone jacks, was able to fit in the bottom of this bad-boy. Clutter be gone, this box really makes the area around/behind my TV look a lot nicer. Amazing how many cables you can stuff in this thing, and the lid is easy to snap on/off while still feeling like it is in properly. Overall a very nice product, and a great brand in general.
customer_reviews.author: ARI J COMET

customer_reviews.title: I love how much space it has
customer_reviews.text: I got it today and installed it to organize all of my cables connected to pc. I love how much space it has!! My power strip is pretty wide (belkin powerstrip with 12 outlets) but I saw a reviewer's photo with the same powerstrip inside the box so purchased with no doubt. I gotta say i love this and I think I will get another one
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Reclaim your desk space!
customer_reviews.text: This box more than met my expectations. Plenty of room to hide all of my desk cables and power cords (all 8 of them) and path everything through a discreet box that disappears behind my monitor. I actually have more room on my desk for the things that matter now that the "urban sprawl" of cables and cords has been tamed!
customer_reviews.author: DebitK

customer_reviews.title: Magic
customer_reviews.text: This item...wait for it...hides cords. Tada!!! A little expensive for what it is, but that's because not many other products do it better. An entire 10 outlet surge protector, a couple of power bricks (small ones) and way too many cords all fit nicely inside this box and make it appear as though there's no rat's nest of electronic devices, when in fact there is. I will likely buy another, hopefully on sale.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Looks like cheap plastic
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed that this product looks like cheap plastic. Another reviewer thought the plastic was of good quality; perhaps the product has changed. The material is very thin and has a flat finish. I was expecting a thicker plastic that was shiny and more attractive. I ended up using it behind the tv rather than along side my desk where it would have been more visible. On the positive side, it's a good concept, has a nice shape, and it's about the right size.
customer_reviews.author: Max Altus

customer_reviews.title: wonderful product...such a simple concept
customer_reviews.text: I love the concept. Granted, it is just a plastic box with slots on each side, but honestly, i cannot believe this is first time i ever saw one. i have 2 and my in-law have another 2. it is great for hiding surge protectors and it quite strong (my 2 year old uses it as a chair every once in a while. it holds a surge protector easily and the slots are large enough to handle pretty much any wire.
customer_reviews.author: ankurbs

customer_reviews.title: Bluelonge boxes rock
customer_reviews.text: I abhor wires. Aren't we supposed to be wireless now? Obviously I'm not, but these very cool boxes hide much of the clutter, keep my cables free form that crappy dust bunny that grows over time. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Hicks

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product. Works beautifully to hide my cords and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. Works beautifully to hide my cords and clean up my space. I took off one star because I think this item is way overpriced for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Momma of Two

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my flat screen TV cords
customer_reviews.text: When I had a large plasma screen TV installed on my wall, along with a slender shelf to hold the DVR, Wi Fi, etc, I needed something to hold all the cords so that they wouldn't show. This worked perfectly. I had a black shelf installed on the wall with the DVR, etc to hook up to the TV. The black cable box fit perfectly on the shelf and is barely noticeable on the black shelf. People are surprised they can't see even one cord anywhere!
customer_reviews.author: R.K.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing! The photos don’t lie! I am so glad I invested in these.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: This worked perfectly and even fit my Belkin 12-plug power ...
customer_reviews.text: This worked perfectly and even fit my Belkin 12-plug power strip, though i had to be careful where I placed the AC adapters inside. The only downside is the price. I don't know why a plastic box has to be so expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Larry S.

customer_reviews.title: It's so nice not to see my large power strip lying on ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had ordered this earlier. It's so nice not to see my large power strip lying on the floor with a bunch of power cords running out of it. Couple this with some cable sleeving and your space will so much more organized.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: What's not to love?
customer_reviews.text: At first I didn't know what all the fuss was about. Then I realized I could put this over a clump of wires and cables that didn't even end at a typical surge protector. From mess to no mess in less than a minute. What's not to love?
customer_reviews.author: MrSax

customer_reviews.title: These cord management boxes are nice and tall so you have plenty of room to ...
customer_reviews.text: These cord management boxes are nice and tall so you have plenty of room to coil up any extra cable without it exploding out of the top like smaller cord management boxes.
customer_reviews.author: bcall

customer_reviews.title: No more bunched up cords!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second box for cable organizing. I hate cords all wrapped up in a bunch on the floor in my livingroom/bedroom.. this sure does the trick for storing all cords/cables by the outlets.... nothing looks messy anymore !!! Price is somewhat steep for a box with two end openings but oh well.... you get what you pay for !
customer_reviews.author: CijiDunne

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cable "neat-freaks"
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Perfect for hiding the unsightly power strips with bulging cables near your TV or computer. This product is large so it does vent well. The lid on the top does have a tendency to get stuck so watch out for that.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel BosticTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up for this black plastic box.
customer_reviews.text: I mean, it seems sort of dumb to be this happy about a black box, but it makes my cables look nice and tidy and keeps my puppy out of them. Could I achieve the same effect with, say, a shoe box? Yes, but it wouldn't look as tidy. I bought a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazing Customer

product_meta.title: Bluelounge CableBox Cable and Cord Management System,Black
product_meta.description:
Color:Black| Size:CableBoxTo keep cable clutter in check, CableBox discreetly conceals excess cable slack and keeps it neatly out of sight under your desk, next to the computer or behind the TV. There is no need to unplug anything first; simply place your surge protector inside the CableBox, tuck in the surplus cables and close the lid. CableBox can accommodate virtually any size power strip, with extra space allotted for cords and adapters. CableBox is made from high-density, flame retardant plastic and is available in Black, White, Moonlight Blue and Light Sage.The CableBox contains brominated flame retardants that comply with ROHS and REACH standards.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Designed to fit all shapes and sizes of surge protectors and power strips, the lid is also the perfect spot to place connected devices
feature_bullets: Keeps excess cords hidden under desks, by the computer or next to the TV
Fits wide and long surge protectors with extra space for cord slack and adapters
Available in Black, White, Moonlight Blue, and Light Sage

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars985 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
